intro: Liabum asclepiadeum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to livestock and humans, making it both a cautionary and ecologically significant species. This plant thrives in dry, open habitats and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
